title: John Legend speaks out about President Trump’s Muslim ban
text:
John Legend speaks out during Producers Guild Awards about President Trump’s Muslim ban John Legend speaks out about President Trump’s Muslim ban NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  45 PM 
John Legend used the stage at the Producers Guild Awards to show his disdain toward President Trump’s Muslim ban. 
Legend, who introduced “La La Land” on Saturday night, spoke out about the executive order that put a 90-day ban on travelers with passports from Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen. 
“Los Angeles is the home of so many immigrants, so many creative people, so many dreamers, and those of us who work in this business have the privilege of shaping how the world perceives this country we love. We are the voice, we are the face of America,” he said, according to PEOPLE . 
“Our America is big, it is free, and it is open to dreamers of all races, all countries, all religions. Our vision of America is directly antithetical to that of President Trump. And I want to specifically tonight reject his vision and affirm that America has to be better than that.” “Our America is big, it is free, and it is open to dreamers of all races, all countries, all religions,” John Legend said at the Producers Guild Awards Saturday night. (Lauren/Variety/REX/Shutterstock/Lauren/Variety/REX/Shutterstock) 
Legend and wife Chrissy Teigen are among those in Hollywood who have consistently voiced their political opinions despite complaints from fans. 
The “All of Me” singer spent the weekend tweeting out stories of people held at the airport because of the new executive order. 
“Shame on America. Shame on Donald Trump,” Legend tweeted Saturday night.
